      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()
      act - do whatever the Pet wants to do.
      boolean canMove()
      canMove - Checks if pet can move
      void dragObj​(java.lang.Class b, int x, int y, greenfoot.GreenfootImage petImg)
      dragObj - If an interactive object gets dragged to the pet, depending on the type of the object, pet stats will change accordingly.
      void eat​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage eat, greenfoot.GreenfootImage drink)
      eat - If food is dragged to the pet, pet will eat the food and hunger stat will go up
      int getEatImgTime()
      getEatImgTime - Returns amount of time left before image associated with the hunger stat disappears
      boolean getEating()
      getEating - Returns eating state of pet
      int getEnergy()
      getEnergy - Returns the current energy stat
      double getHappiness()
      getHappiness - Returns current happiness stat

      getHappyImgTime - Returns amount of time left before image associated with the happy stat disappears
      int getHunger()
      getHunger() - Returns the current hunger stat
      greenfoot.GreenfootImage getImgPlay()
      getImgPlay - Returns current image that will be shown when the happiness stat increases
      int getImpatience()
      getImpatience - Returns the current impatience level
      int getMouseX()
      getMouseX - Returns x position of mouse
      int getMouseY()
      getMouseY - Returns y position of mouse
      boolean getPlaying()
      getPlaying - Returns playing state of pet
      boolean getSleeping()
      getSleeping - Returns sleeping state of pet
      int getSpeed()
      getSpeed - Returns current speed of pet
      int getTime()
      getTime - Returns the current time
      int getWalkImgTime()
      getWalkImgTime - Returns amount of time left before image associated with movement disappears
      boolean getWalking()
      getWalking - Returns walking state of pet
      boolean isDead()
      isDead - Returns 'true' if hunger is 0% and pet has died.
      void play​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage happy, greenfoot.GreenfootImage annoyed, greenfoot.GreenfootImage mad, greenfoot.GreenfootImage playUkulele, greenfoot.GreenfootImage photo)
      play - If pet is clicked, happiness of the pet goes up and image changes.

      sleep - Pet will become sleepy when the energy stat is between 20 and 50.

      • act

        public void act()
        act - do whatever the Pet wants to do. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • tick

        public void tick()
        tick - Decreases the Pet Stats over time

      • play

        public void play​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage happy,
                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage annoyed,
                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage mad,
                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage playUkulele,
                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage photo)
        play - If pet is clicked, happiness of the pet goes up and image changes. However, if the impatience of the pet is high, pet will be mad and happiness stat will not change

      • sleep

        public void sleep​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage normal,
                  greenfoot.GreenfootImage sleepy,
                  greenfoot.GreenfootImage sleep)
        sleep - Pet will become sleepy when the energy stat is between 20 and 50. Pet will fall asleep when energy is less than 20

      • walk

        public void walk​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage normal,
                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage ride,
                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage hero)
        walk - Pet will walk to wherever mouse is click. Pet will move when the up, down, right, left arrow keys are pressed. Pet will also change speed when it interacts with a Cape or Scooter object

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        canMove - Checks if pet can move

      • eat

        public void eat​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage eat,
                greenfoot.GreenfootImage drink)
        eat - If food is dragged to the pet, pet will eat the food and hunger stat will go up

      • dragObj

        public void dragObj​(java.lang.Class b,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    greenfoot.GreenfootImage petImg)
        dragObj - If an interactive object gets dragged to the pet, depending on the type of the object, pet stats will change accordingly. Object will disappear once it has stopped being dragged and a new object will reappear

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        isDead - Returns 'true' if hunger is 0% and pet has died. Returns false otherwise
